an3.77:4.1: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side,
an3.77:4.3: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘future existence’.
an3.77:5.1: “If, Ānanda, there were no deeds to result in the sensual realm, would existence in the sensual realm still come about?”
an3.77:5.3: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
an3.77:5.4: The intention and aim of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a lower realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
an3.77:6.1: If there were no deeds to result in the realm of luminous form, would existence in the realm of luminous form still be evident?”
an3.77:6.3: “So, Ānanda, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
an3.77:6.4: The intention and aim of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a lower realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
an3.77:7.1: If there were no deeds to result in the formless realm, would existence in the formless realm still be evident?”
an3.77:7.3: “So, deeds are the field, consciousness is the seed, and craving is the moisture.
an3.77:7.4: The intention and aim of sentient beings—hindered by ignorance and fettered by craving—is established in a higher realm. That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.
an3.77:7.5: That’s how future existence is defined.”
